review_title: Take the good with the bad
job_title: Registered Respiratory Therapist in Montgomery, AL
pros: Amazing place to work. Probably my favorite place that I’ve worked. Pretty relaxed atmosphere provided you do your job safely and effectively. Friendly environment. No matter where my assignments have been, I get along well with all allied healthcare workers and doctors. Not a single painting on the wall can be found on another floor as they are all donated and unique ( I know it may not seem like much, but to me, it’s been nice and makes it feel a little less like a typical hospital)
cons: Pay is not competitive with other hospitals in the area, despite being in one of Alabamas top paying cities for REspiratory Therapists. Benefits and insurance plans are not as good as other place’s Ive worked. Typical Office politics you’d find just about anywhere. Management doesn’t seem to have a problem bending the rules when it serves their interests. High turnover, so it’s difficult to foster good work relationships because of the revolving door of therapists and nurses coming and going.

pros: Great people, Good overtime potential, Good PCM support, Good unit.
cons: Management is clueless a lot of the time when it comes to patient care (they have been out of it for too long)!  We are having to make do with less staff, thus creating decreased satisfaction scores.  There are some nurses who are constantly written up for making med errors, etc. and this is almost never addressed.  It seems if one merely shows up to work and does not call in, one is guaranteed of a job, no matter how shoddy their work performance might be.  This creates animosity among employees, compromises patient care and well being and is just plain irresponsible.  Moreover, when getting report from certain individuals one has to constantly be looking "for the other shoe to fall" and to not get caught up in their incompetence.  Most of us value our licensure and are not willing to have it put in harm's way because of unacceptable nursing practice on the aforementioned individual's part.

review_title: My experience at Jackson has been very positive and a great learning experience.

job_title: Inpatient Physical Therapist in Montgomery, AL
pros: I was extremely over-paid working Per Diem at full time hours making $52/hr, but considering the work environment perhaps that rate was appropriate...?
cons: Hopefully a lot has changed since I worked at Jackson Hospital in Montgomery, AL, however, when I did work there for about 8 months, it was an extremely political place and difficult place to work. There were horror stories about some of the doctors working there being very controlling of how things were done and by the time I left, I had horror stories of my own. Many areas lacked appropriate supplies. Rolling walkers for pt's to use could not be found except for the one's carried by rehab. dept. staff. Also hoyer lifts or gerichairs could not be found on nursing units to use with heavy dependent transfer patients and nurses would not move these pt's at all since only Rehab staff were "qualified" to manage their mobility and nurses did not have the equipment to do it anyway. Wheelchairs in the hospital had their removable leg rests permanently welded on which can make transfers very dangerous in many situations. When I worked at Jackson, Rehab staff were asked to bill for 90% of their time (which is impossible to do even if you could document all of your caseload in the remaining 10% of your time). Case Management and MD's frequently would make discharge decisions and tell pt's where they were going to go and then afterwards consult PT/OT staff to see the pt and expect therapy staff to support those decisions even when pt functional ability did not support those decisions. This was especially prominent on the orthopedics floor where many pt's (esp. total joint replacement pt's) who were able to mobilize independently were still encouraged to go to Rehab by the case manager and doctor.

pros: My position at Jackson is challenging and rewarding. There is always something new to learn as technology changes.
cons: I really can’t think of anything negative to say here, I have worked in some bad environments and this is great, it is more like family.

review_title: It has been a great place to work
